text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen I am 
making a southern Thai dish today called gai tom

kamin now gai is chicken tom means to boil 
and kamin is turmeric this guy right here now

you don't see turmeric used much in Thai food but 
in the South they used to make a lot in many many

different applications now this dish was requested 
of me recently and when I got the request I was

super excited because this is one of those dishes 
that you don't find in Thai restaurants overseas

it is the epitome of simple rustic home cooking 
that is super delicious let's get started so I am

using chicken wings for this and these are the 
little drumette and I love using chicken wings

because there's so much bones and cartilage in it 
that you can just add water and your broth will

become like really concentrated chicken stock if 
you want to use boneless chicken you have to use

chicken stock instead of water all right so what 
I've done here I've already marinated this in just

some fish sauce and some sugar you don't have 
to marinate if you don't have time but I find

that if you don't if you just throw the chicken 
straight into the soup the meat inside is not

as flavorful all right and now I'm just going 
to cover this with water yes it's one of those

awesome I throw everything in the pot and let it 
go kind of thing and while that's coming to a boil

I'm going to add my herbs I've got some shallots 
here lots of shallots and the shallots are going

to spend a lot of time in the soup and becoming 
very soft and sweet and flavoring the broth I may

have over filled this pot slightly we'll see now 
some crushed garlic again the garlic is going to

flavor the broth and then they're going to become 
soft and sweet love slowly cooked garlic what I

call the thumb yum Trinity lemongrass galangal 
and kaffir lime leaves so the galangal I freeze

them in rounds like this and then when I need them 
in soups I just throw them directly and you don't

even need to thaw them lemongrass I also freeze so 
when I use fresh lemongrass I always smash it and

if you're using fresh you want to do that to help 
break up the cells help the aroma come out but

these I have frozen and when you freeze lemongrass 
little ice crystals will have already broken the

cells so you'll notice there are a lot softer when 
they're thawed so you don't need to smash them the

flavors will come out more easily my kaffir lime 
leaves I want to make sure I give them a good

tearing bruise them turmeric now I'm using fresh 
turmeric today when you work with fresh turmeric

you don't want to be cutting it or peeling it 
on a wooden cutting board or any cutting board

that you don't want to get stained yellow because 
that will likely happen so I'm just going to cut

out slices thin slices and look at that beautiful 
orange color this will actually turn yellow once

you put it in the food but the root itself is 
orange and if you don't have fresh you can use

powder now turmeric has a very distinct flavor 
if you're not familiar with it you may want to

start with less and add su you know if you find 
that it's not enough you can add more straight up

it doesn't smell great but mix with other herbs 
and other food does add a unique character my

hands stained yellow already this stuff treat it 
like radioactive substance I mean wear gloves if

you don't want your hands stained like this now 
because I already put the fish sauce and a little

bit of sugar in the chicken itself I'm not going 
to season it any further right now I'll just come

and adjust and tweak it at the end so 30 minutes 
roughly until the chicken is fork tender and that

timing will depend on the cut of chicken as well 
if you're using drumettes it'll be about 30 all

right let's see mmm look at that it smells so 
good in here and you want to check that it's

fork-tender and all you do is you stick a fork 
in it and it should go in very very easily with

no resistance now I'm going to add some tartness 
to it so traditionally we use a dried fruit called

some CAG which is very sour and you just put a 
few slices in here I can't find that here it's

even hard to find in Thailand itself it's a very 
uniquely southern thing so I'm going to use just

Tamron if you want to just do a squeeze of lime 
that'll be fine as well stir that in so now I'm

going to give it a taste and just the saltiness 
look at the color that golden beautiful color

it's so nice oh so good oh that's broth is so 
rich because of the chicken wings mm-hmm that's

just a touch of salt just to get the seasoning 
perfect and this is one of those things that's

better the next day so if you get a chance to 
do this in advance I would do that and now you

can leave this as an unspoken comforting chicken 
soup type thing but I like this a little spicy so

I am going to add some crushed Thai chili so I've 
got some Thai chilies here that have just crushed

briefly in my mortar and pestle and there is 
a difference between adding fresh chilies at

the end versus letting it cook with the chicken 
because the flavor of raw chilies is different

from the flavor of slow simmer chilies and so 
depending on what you like you can decide to

add at the end or in the beginning and we'll turn 
this off now also we use green chilies since the

red that will give a different aroma look how 
rich that brought this oh my gosh now the herbs

the lemongrass galangal and lime leaves we don't 
eat that but I like to include it in the bowl just

so people know what's in here oh definitely don't 
eat the piece of turmeric it won't taste good you

can try it alright so excited for this a little 
freshness with some cilantro on top oh yeah I'm

not going to wait for my rice to cook I'm just 
going to taste it right here for us is so good

now if you want to pour this over rice you 
might want to bump up the seasoning a little

bit just so it's stronger but if you want to have 
it straight up then you can keep it kind of mellow

Oh so go gotta have this again oh it's so 
comforting and well balanced is the word

that comes to mind the hardness is just ever 
so slight but enough to brighten everything

the cilantro adds a bit of a coolness to it 
freshness then some of you might think hey

is that similar to what thumb yarmulkes the 
herbs are kind of the same and yes the herbs

are similar but you will quickly find that 
the tumor really does add a unique character

and the flavor is not as sharp as a foam YUM 
Wow that is some seriously good dish and all

I did is literally threw everything in a 
pot and let it go how much easier could it

be so I hope you give this a try the recipe as 
always is beyond hot Thai kitchen calm I don't

know what the weather is like where you are but 
here it's cold and wintry so this kind of stuff

is perfect when you make it send me a photo on 
Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I will see you

next time for your next dish this tiny it smells 
so good in here now you want to check that the

chicken is fork tender and you simply do that 
by forking the chicken No so what should I say
